sub_topic: Finding the maximum or minimum value of a trigonometric function
message_1: What is the maximum value of the function f(x) = 2sin(x) + 3cos(x) on the interval [0, 2π]?
message_2:
To find the maximum value of the function f(x) = 2sin(x) + 3cos(x) on the interval [0, 2π], we can use the following formula:

max_value = √(a^2 + b^2)

where a and b are the coefficients of sin(x) and cos(x), respectively.

In this case, a = 2 and b = 3. So,

max_value = √(2^2 + 3^2)
max_value = √(4 + 9)
max_value = √13

The maximum value of the function f(x) = 2sin(x) + 3cos(x) on the interval [0, 2π] is √13.
